lines.gurmukhi: crn kml mkrMd rs luiBq huie AMg AMg ibsm sRbMg mY smwny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Makarand Ras Loubhit Hui , Ang Ang Bisam Srabang Mai Samaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The loving disciples of the True Guru whose every limb of the body is intoxicated in the elixir-like Naam of the Lord remain absorbed in the Lord whose form is awesome and enrapturing.

lines.gurmukhi: diRsit drs ilv dIpk pqMg sMg sbd suriq miRg nwd huie ihrny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Drisati Daras Liv Deepak Patang Sanga , Sabad Surati Mrig Naad Hui Hiranay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a moth is always absorbed in love of light, so is a devotee's mind focused on a glimpse of the True Guru. As a deer is enchanted by the tune of Ghanda Herha (a musical instrument of old times) so does a devotee remain engrossed in the melodious tune of

lines.gurmukhi: kwm inhkwm kRoDwkRoD inrloB loB moh inrmoh AhMmyv hU ljwny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Nihakaam Krodhaakrodh Niralobh Lobha , Moh Niramoh Ahanmayv Hoo Lajaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Guru-oriented Sikh is free from the effects of lust, anger, avarice, attachment and shy of pride and other vices.

lines.gurmukhi: ibsmY ibsm AscrjY Ascrj mY AdBuq prmdBuq AsQwny hY ]293]
lines.transliteration_english: Bisamai Bisam Asacharajai Asacharaj Mai , Adabhout Paramadabhout Asadaanay Hai ?293?

Shabad OS B.translation: The mind of Guru-conscious and practitioners of Naam resides in the mystical tenth door. This is a place that is full of ecstasy, astonishing beyond astonishments and most amazing. (293)
